Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Histone H1 protein (antimicrobial protein; natural AMPs; Histone-derived; fish, animals; UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (30.56%) toOncorhyncin II.   K: 25%; A: 14%. GRAVY: -0.87; M Wt: 19147.98; M formula: C848H1520N270O222S1, mol ex coeff: 2980.Activity: active against E. coli D31 (MIC 31 ug/ml). The effect can be clearly seen on bacterial morphology (SEM), implying membrane disruption.Entry history: The original entry has been merged with AP410. Replaced 11/2023
Literature Information.Author: ichards RC, O'Neil DB, Thibault P, Ewart KV. 2001
Literature Information.Reference: Biochem Biophys Res Commun. 2001 Jun 15;284(3):549-55. doi: 10.1006/bbrc.2001.5020.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Histone H1: an antimicrobial protein of Atlantic salmon (Salmo salar).
